revised_title: Heat Conduction in Highly Rarefied Air: A Pivotal Study by William Crookes
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
tldr: In this study, William Crookes examines the transfer of heat across air of varying densities and pressures. He discovered that heat conduction is almost independent of pressure, but as pressure decreases, the rate of cooling slows down significantly. This research has implications for understanding heat transfer in rarefied environments, such as in outer space.
